channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Covid-19 tracing app 'unusable' for blind and those with low vision
item.description: Experts in technology for the disabilities are slamming the government for releasing a contact tracing app they can't use.

item.title: International travel in a post-Covid world
item.description: The Detail - International travel seems likely to have a slow and confusing return once nations' borders reopen.

item.title: Live: Covid-19 updates in New Zealand and around the world on 26 May
item.description: Groups of 100 people will be allowed to get together this weekend for the first time in months. Follow our blog for the latest.

item.title: Substance abuse, gambling spiked over lockdown
item.description: Addiction services have reported a rise in drinking, cannabis use and online gambling over the lockdown period.

item.title: Reports of child abuse dropped during Covid-19 lockdown
item.description: There was a sharp drop in the number of child abuse reports made to Oranga Tamariki over the Covid-19 lockdown period.

item.title: Man dies in Auckland workplace accident
item.description: A man has died after a workplace accident in the Auckland suburb of Rosedale.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in NZ and around the world on 25 May
item.description: Today further benefit payments were announced, an earthquake interrupted the PM on live TV, and the opposition reshuffled their caucus, creating a Covid-19 portfolio.

item.title: EQC level 2 rules causing delays, stress - Christchurch couple
item.description: An elderly Christchurch couple who have already waited nearly a decade for their house to be repaired are crying foul over EQC's site visit policy under alert level 2.

item.title: Covid-19: Summer festival tickets sell fast despite local-only lineups
item.description: Some of the country's major summer music festivals are nearly sold out, despite organisers being unable to lock in their line-ups while the borders remain shut.

item.title: Remaining backpackers enjoy NZ after lockdown
item.description: Our borders may be closed but some international backpackers are still making the most of their New Zealand travel dreams.

item.title: Okarito gecko species rediscovered decades later
item.description: DOC rangers have found the Okarito gecko, a lizard species last encountered decades ago, on the West Coast.

item.title: Midwife censured after confusion leads to baby's death
item.description: An independent midwife has been censured after mistaking a woman's progress during labour, which resulted in a baby's death.

item.title: NZ Muslims celebrate unusual end of Ramadan amid Covid-19
item.description: Thousands of Muslims have been celebrating Eid-Al-Fitr, the end of the holy month of Ramadan, but the usually social event has been a bit different this year.

item.title: Secondary school international students stuck in New Zealand
item.description: Travel restrictions are creating uncertainty for thousands of foreign school children who came to New Zealand for education and now cannot leave.

item.title: Search for Tasman Trampers hampered again by bad weather
item.description: The search for two missing trampers in north west Nelson has been suspended for the day due to poor weather.

item.title: Live: Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and around the world on 25 May
item.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says Cabinet will think about level 1 no later than 22 June. Read back through RNZ's live updates for 25 May here.

item.title: Baby on board: Man charged over car theft
item.description: A 52-year-old man is due to appear in the Auckland District Court today after a car with a baby inside was stolen this month.

item.title: Arthur Taylor denied access to property where he lived and worked
item.description: The High Court has ruled repeat offender Arthur Taylor cannot go back to the house he has called home since his release from prison.
